collections.title: Analytics
collections.content:
The analytics tab allows you to monitor your warm-up campaigns.

 

1. On the "Inbox" tab, select the inbox you would like to get the analytics

2. In the "Actions" column, click on the "Edit" button

 

3. A new page opens and displays all the data of the campaign (emails sent, replies, interactions, spam rate, etc.)

  • "Emails sent" corresponds to the number of emails automatically sent from your inbox since the beginning of the campaign.

  • "Replies" refers to the number of replies sent by Warmbox inboxes network to the emails sent. It depends on the reply rate you defined in the warm-up settings.

  • "Interactions" indicates the number of positive interactions (responses, openings, removal from spam, starring, etc.) that our inboxes network had with your inbox since the beginning of the campaign.

  • "Spam Rate" informs you about the proportion of warm-up emails sent from your inbox that end up in spam. This is an indicator to follow the increase of your email deliverability.

 

 

The analytics tab also displays information about the sending schedule and the recent activities (message sent from your inbox, reply received, etc.).

 

💡 You can edit the parameters/delete specific warm-up day directly in the "Custom Schedule" section.

collections.title: Redirect Emails to a specific folder
collections.content:
To warm up your inbox, Warmbox automatically answers your warm-up emails according to a reply rate you defined. As a result, you will receive many emails from Warmbox inboxes network.

 

In order to ensure that your inbox remains tidy despite this extra flow of "warm-up" emails, you need to store these in a separate folder.

 

For Gmail - Gsuite

1. In Gmail, click on the "Settings" icon and select "See all settings"

 

2. In the "Filters and Blocked Addresses" tab and click on the "Create a new filter" button

 

3. Type "- wbx" in the subject field in lowercase and with a space between "-" and "wbx" for the first filter, then click on the "Create filter" button.

 

4. Then, select the following boxes:

  • "Skip the Inbox (Archive it)"

  • "Apply the label" and choose the label you want to apply or create a new one

  • "Also apply filter to X matching conversations"

 

5. Finally, click on the "Create Filter" button

 

6. Congrats! 🎉 You successfully set up a filter! Warm-up emails coming from Warmbox will be stored in a specific folder. You can consult those emails in the folder in the left bar menu of Gmail.

collections.title: Start/Stop the warm up
collections.content:
You can choose to start or stop the warm-up process at any time. When the warm-up is stopped, no emails will be send from your inbox and no interactions will be generated with your inbox.

 

1. On the "Inbox" tab dashboard, select the inbox you would like to update

2. In the "Actions" column, click on the "Switch" button to activate or deactivate the warm-up

 

💡 Note: When the switch button is on the left and the bar is gray, the warm-up is disabled. When it's on the right and the bar is blue, the warm-up is activated.

 

3. Congrats! 🎉 You successfully started/stopped your inbox warm-up!

collections.title: Delete an Inbox
collections.content:
At any time, you can permanently delete an inbox from Warmbox. The tool will then stop warming up this inbox and all analytics related to this inbox will be deleted.

 

1. On the "Inbox" tab, select the inbox you would like to delete

2. In the "Actions" column, click on the "Delete" button

 

🛑 The deletion of an inbox is definitive. Your sending parameters and analytics will not be saved.

 

3. After reading the alert message, click on the "Confirm" button

4. Congrats! 🎉 You successfully deleted an inbox!
